bibl.title: Albert H. Young and Kamasaburo Sugiuro v. United States. Order of Dismissal as to Petitioner Young.

div1.p: In the District Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division
In the matter of the Petition of Albert H. Young and Kamasaburo Sugiura, alias B. K. Sugiura, aliens, for Writ of Habeas Corpus | #2628 Order of Dismissal as to Petitioner Young

This cause coming on duly for hearing this 9th day of March, A.D. 1914, before the above entitled Court, upon the motion of Albert H. Young, one of the petitioners in said cause, to dismiss further proceedings as to him; the Court being fully advised in the premises, it is therefore, hereby

Ordered, Adjudged and Decreed, that the appeal Motion for Returning of the above entitled cause heretofore noted, be, insofar as the same may effect the said petitioner Albert H. Young, and the same is hereby fully dismissed and discharged.
Done in open Court this 9th day of March, A.D. 1914.
Due and legal service of copy hereof admitted on this 9th day of Marc, A.D. 1914
In the District Court of the United States, for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division B08-4-411
In the matter of the Petition of Albert H. Young, et. al, aliens, for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
Order of Dismissal as to Petitioner Young
Filed in this U.S. District Court, Western Dist. of Washington, Northern Division May 9, 1914 Frank L. Crosby, Clerk, By EML Deputy.
R.W. McClellan H. A. P. MYers Walter L. Johnstone Attorneys for Petitioners
